item.title: Importance of 2FA & how to enable it
item.description: Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) is crucial for online security because it adds an extra layer of protection. It requires users to provide two forms of authentication before accessing an account, making it harder for attackers to gain unauthorized access. 2FA prevents common threats like stolen passwords, phishing attacks, and credential reuse. It’s widely used in both personal and business settings to comply with security standards, prevent data breaches, and provide peace of mind.
